summary: This bill, the Child Care Availability and Affordability Act, amends the Internal Revenue Code to expand tax benefits related to childcare. It increases the employer-provided child care credit, the amount excludable for dependent care assistance programs, and introduces a new, refundable household and dependent care credit. The bill defines qualifying individuals, employment-related expenses, and provides special rules for small businesses and married couples. It also makes conforming and clerical amendments to various sections of the tax code. The changes are effective after the enactment date.
